topPRs.title: Fix: GIF animations not playing in Telegram
topPRs.author: 0xRabbidfly
topPRs.body:
# Fix: GIF animations not playing in Telegram

## Problem
GIF attachments are being sent as static images instead of animations in Telegram messages.

## Root Cause
The `sendMessageInChunks` method uses a `typeMap` with prefix matching that can match GIFs to the generic `'image'` prefix before checking the specific `'image/gif'` prefix, depending on JavaScript object iteration order. This causes GIFs to be sent via `sendMedia()` with `MediaType.PHOTO` instead of `MediaType.ANIMATION`.

```typescript
// Original buggy code
const typeMap = {
  'image/gif': MediaType.ANIMATION,
  image: MediaType.PHOTO,  // ← Matches 'image/gif'.startsWith('image')
  ...
};
```

## Solution
- Add explicit GIF detection before generic image handling
- Use `ctx.replyWithAnimation()` directly for GIFs to preserve animation
- Exclude `.gif` from the `isImage` regex pattern
- Improve media routing with explicit type checks and proper fallbacks
- Fix async anti-pattern: replace `.map(async)` with `for await` loop

## Changes
- ✅ Separate `isGif` check before `isImage` 
- ✅ Use Telegram's `replyWithAnimation()` for GIFs
- ✅ Add fallback handling for failed GIF/video sends
- ✅ Modernize attachment handling with direct Telegram API methods
- ✅ Remove unreliable prefix-based type mapping for images/videos

## Testing
- Tested with live Telegram bot sending GIF cards
- Verified GIFs now animate correctly instead of showing as static images
- Build passes successfully
- TypeScript compilation successful

## Risk Assessment
**LOW RISK** - This is a targeted fix that:
- Only affects attachment handling flow
- Adds explicit checks without removing existing fallbacks
- Improves code reliability with defensive programming
- Doesn't change API surface or break existing functionality

## Related
Fixes the issue where content with `contentType: 'image/gif'` attachments are displayed as static images in Telegram clients.

topPRs.title: feat: migrate to runtime.handleMessage()
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
Migrates Telegram plugin from event-based message handling to direct
MessageService calls, making message flow easier to trace and debug.

Changes:
- Replace runtime.emitEvent(MESSAGE_RECEIVED) with runtime.handleMessage()
- Remove unused event imports (EventType, TelegramEventTypes, TelegramMessageReceivedPayload)
- Update @elizaos/core dependency to workspace:* for local development
- Fix Zod error typing in environment.ts validation

Benefits:
- Clear call stack: Telegram → runtime.handleMessage() → MessageService
- Easier debugging: can step through entire flow without event routing
- Better developer experience: no hidden event dispatching

Before:
  this.runtime.emitEvent(EventType.MESSAGE_RECEIVED, {
    runtime: this.runtime, message: memory, callback, source: 'telegram'
  });
  this.runtime.emitEvent(TelegramEventTypes.MESSAGE_RECEIVED, {...});

After:
  await this.runtime.handleMessage(memory, callback);

Requires: feat/core-message-service-interface

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Replaces event-based Telegram message handling with direct MessageService.handleMessage calls, and cleans up Zod validation and document-processing logs/formatting.
> 
> - **Telegram message handling**:
>   - Replace `runtime.emitEvent(...MESSAGE_RECEIVED...)` with direct `runtime.messageService.handleMessage(runtime, memory, callback)` and add missing-service guard.
>   - Minor refactors in `processMessage`/document handlers: consistent quotes, multiline conditions, improved error logging, and attachment cleanup mapping style.
> - **Config validation (`src/environment.ts`)**:
>   - Use `ZodError.issues` over `errors` when building error messages.
>   - Minor signature/formatting adjustments.
>
